SEARCH
Package it.astromark.authentication.service

Interface AuthenticationService

All Known Implementing Classes:
AuthenticationServiceImpl
@Service public interface AuthenticationService
Service interface for managing authentication-related operations. Provides methods for user login, logout, and token validation.

  • Method Details

    • login

      SchoolUser login(UserLoginRequest user)
      Authenticates a user and allows them to log in.
      Parameters:
      user - the login request containing user credentials
      Returns:
      a `SchoolUser` object representing the logged-in user Pre-condition: The `user` must not be null and must contain valid credentials. Post-condition: Returns the authenticated user details if the login is successful.

    • getUser

      SchoolUser getUser(UUID id, String role)
      Retrieves user details based on their ID and role.
      Parameters:
      id - the UUID of the user
      role - the role of the user (e.g., student, teacher, parent, etc.)
      Returns:
      a `SchoolUser` object representing the user Pre-condition: The `id` must not be null. The `role` must not be null or empty. Post-condition: Returns the user details if the ID and role are valid.

    • verify

      String verify(String username, String password, String schoolCode, String role)
      Verifies user credentials and returns a verification status.
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user
      password - the password of the user
      schoolCode - the school code associated with the user
      role - the role of the user
      Returns:
      a verification string indicating the result Pre-condition: The `username`, `password`, `schoolCode`, and `role` must not be null or empty. Post-condition: Returns a verification result indicating whether the credentials are valid.

    • firstLogin

      SchoolUser firstLogin(@NotNull @NotNull UserFirstLoginRequest user)
      Handles the first login process for a new user.
      Parameters:
      user - the request containing details for the first login
      Returns:
      a `SchoolUser` object representing the user after the first login Pre-condition: The `user` must not be null and must contain valid details for the first login. Post-condition: Returns the user details after the first login is completed.

    • getRole

      org.springframework.security.core.GrantedAuthority getRole(SchoolUser user)
      Retrieves the granted authority (role) of a user.
      Parameters:
      user - the `SchoolUser` object
      Returns:
      the granted authority of the user Pre-condition: The `user` must not be null. Post-condition: Returns the granted authority of the specified user.

    • isStudent

      boolean isStudent()
      Checks if the current user is a student.
      Returns:
      true if the user is a student, false otherwise Pre-condition: The user must be logged in. Post-condition: Returns true if the user is identified as a student.

    • isTeacher

      boolean isTeacher()
      Checks if the current user is a teacher.
      Returns:
      true if the user is a teacher, false otherwise Pre-condition: The user must be logged in. Post-condition: Returns true if the user is identified as a teacher.

    • isParent

      boolean isParent()
      Checks if the current user is a parent.
      Returns:
      true if the user is a parent, false otherwise Pre-condition: The user must be logged in. Post-condition: Returns true if the user is identified as a parent.

    • isSecretary

      boolean isSecretary()
      Checks if the current user is a secretary.
      Returns:
      true if the user is a secretary, false otherwise Pre-condition: The user must be logged in. Post-condition: Returns true if the user is identified as a secretary.

    • getParent

      Optional<Parent> getParent()
      Retrieves the parent details if the user is a parent.
      Returns:
      an `Optional Parent containing the parent details if available Pre-condition: The user must be logged in and identified as a parent. Post-condition: Returns an optional containing the parent details or empty if not applicable.

    • getStudent

      Optional<Student> getStudent()
      Retrieves the student details if the user is a student.
      Returns:
      an `Optional Student` containing the student details if available Pre-condition: The user must be logged in and identified as a student. Post-condition: Returns an optional containing the student details or empty if not applicable.

    • getTeacher

      Optional<Teacher> getTeacher()
      Retrieves the teacher details if the user is a teacher.
      Returns:
      an `Optional Teacher` containing the teacher details if available Pre-condition: The user must be logged in and identified as a teacher. Post-condition: Returns an optional containing the teacher details or empty if not applicable.

    • getSecretary

      Optional<Secretary> getSecretary()
      Retrieves the secretary details if the user is a secretary.
      Returns:
      an `Optional Secretary` containing the secretary details if available Pre-condition: The user must be logged in and identified as a secretary. Post-condition: Returns an optional containing the secretary details or empty if not applicable.
